segment.source: View the Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection Dashboard
segment.target: View the Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection Dashboard

segment.source: Use the Dashboard to identify machines at risk, keep track of the status of the service, and see statistics and information about machines and alerts.
segment.target: Use the Dashboard to identify machines at risk, keep track of the status of the service, and see statistics and information about machines and alerts.

segment.source: View the Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection Dashboard
segment.target: View the Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection Dashboard

segment.source: Applies to:
segment.target: Applies to:

segment.source: Windows 10 Insider Preview Build 14332 or later
segment.target: Windows 10 Insider Preview Build 14332 or later

segment.source: Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection (Windows Defender ATP)
segment.target: Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection (Windows Defender ATP)

segment.source: [Some information relates to pre-released product which may be substantially modified before it's commercially released.
segment.target: [Some information relates to pre-released product which may be substantially modified before it's commercially released.

segment.source: Microsoft makes no warranties, express or implied, with respect to the information provided here.]
segment.target: Microsoft makes no warranties, express or implied, with respect to the information provided here.]

segment.source: The Dashboard displays a snapshot of:
segment.target: The Dashboard displays a snapshot of:

segment.source: The latest active alerts on your network
segment.target: The latest active alerts on your network

segment.source: Machines reporting
segment.target: Machines reporting

segment.source: Top machines with active alerts
segment.target: Top machines with active alerts

segment.source: The overall status of Windows Defender ATP for the past 30 days
segment.target: The overall status of Windows Defender ATP for the past 30 days

segment.source: Machines with active malware detections
segment.target: Machines with active malware detections

segment.source: You can explore and investigate alerts and machines to quickly determine if, where, and when suspicious activities occurred in your network to help you understand the context they appeared in.
segment.target: You can explore and investigate alerts and machines to quickly determine if, where, and when suspicious activities occurred in your network to help you understand the context they appeared in.

segment.source: From the Dashboard you will see aggregated events to facilitate the identification of significant events or behaviors on a machine.
segment.target: From the Dashboard you will see aggregated events to facilitate the identification of significant events or behaviors on a machine.

segment.source: You can also drill down into granular events and low-level indicators.
segment.target: You can also drill down into granular events and low-level indicators.

segment.source: It also has clickable tiles that give visual cues on the overall health status of your organization.
segment.target: It also has clickable tiles that give visual cues on the overall health status of your organization.

segment.source: Each tile opens a detailed view of the corresponding overview.
segment.target: Each tile opens a detailed view of the corresponding overview.

segment.source: ATP alerts
segment.target: ATP alerts

segment.source: You can view the overall number of active ATP alerts from the last 30 days in your network from the ATP alerts tile.
segment.target: You can view the overall number of active ATP alerts from the last 30 days in your network from the ATP alerts tile.

segment.source: Alerts are grouped into New and In progress.
segment.target: Alerts are grouped into New and In progress.

segment.source: Click on each slice or severity to see a list of alerts from the past 30 days
segment.target: Click on each slice or severity to see a list of alerts from the past 30 days

segment.source: Each group is further sub-categorized into their corresponding alert severity levels.
segment.target: Each group is further sub-categorized into their corresponding alert severity levels.

segment.source: Click the number of alerts inside each alert ring to see a sorted view of that category's queue (New or In progress).
segment.target: Click the number of alerts inside each alert ring to see a sorted view of that category's queue (New or In progress).

segment.source: See the View and organize the Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection Alerts queue topic for more information.
segment.target: See the View and organize the Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection Alerts queue topic for more information.

segment.source: The Latest ATP alerts section includes the latest active alerts in your network.
segment.target: The Latest ATP alerts section includes the latest active alerts in your network.

segment.source: Each row includes an alert severity category and a short description of the alert.
segment.target: Each row includes an alert severity category and a short description of the alert.

segment.source: Click an alert to see its detailed view, or Alerts queue at the top of the list to go directly to the Alerts queue.
segment.target: Click an alert to see its detailed view, or Alerts queue at the top of the list to go directly to the Alerts queue.

segment.source: See the Investigate Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection alerts and View and organize the Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection Alerts queue topics for more information.
segment.target: See the Investigate Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection alerts and View and organize the Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection Alerts queue topics for more information.

segment.source: Machines at risk
segment.target: Machines at risk

segment.source: This tile shows you a list of machines with the highest number of active alerts.
segment.target: This tile shows you a list of machines with the highest number of active alerts.

segment.source: The total number of alerts for each machine is shown in a circle next to the machine name, and then further categorized by severity levels at the far end of the tile (hover over each severity bar to its label).
segment.target: The total number of alerts for each machine is shown in a circle next to the machine name, and then further categorized by severity levels at the far end of the tile (hover over each severity bar to its label).

segment.source: The Machines at risk tile shows a list of machines with the highest number of alerts, and a breakdown of the severity of the alerts
segment.target: The Machines at risk tile shows a list of machines with the highest number of alerts, and a breakdown of the severity of the alerts

segment.source: Click the name of the machine to see details about that machine.
segment.target: Click the name of the machine to see details about that machine.

segment.source: See the Investigate Windows Defender ATP alerts topic for more information.
segment.target: See the Investigate Windows Defender ATP alerts topic for more information.

segment.source: You can also click Machines view at the top of the tile to go directly to the Machines view, sorted by the number of active alerts.
segment.target: You can also click Machines view at the top of the tile to go directly to the Machines view, sorted by the number of active alerts.

segment.source: See the Investigate machines in the Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection Machines view topic for more information.
segment.target: See the Investigate machines in the Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection Machines view topic for more information.

segment.source: Status
segment.target: Status

segment.source: The Status tile informs you if the service is active and running and the specific number of machines (endpoints) reporting to Windows Defender ATP.
segment.target: The Status tile informs you if the service is active and running and the specific number of machines (endpoints) reporting to Windows Defender ATP.

segment.source: The Status tile shows an overall indicator of the service and the total number of machines reporting to the service
segment.target: The Status tile shows an overall indicator of the service and the total number of machines reporting to the service

segment.source: Machines reporting
segment.target: Machines reporting

segment.source: The Machines reporting tile shows a bar graph that represents the number of machines reporting alerts daily.
segment.target: The Machines reporting tile shows a bar graph that represents the number of machines reporting alerts daily.

segment.source: Hover over individual bars on the graph to see the exact number of machines reporting in each day.
segment.target: Hover over individual bars on the graph to see the exact number of machines reporting in each day.

segment.source: The Machines reporting tile shows the number of machines reporting each day for the past 30 days
segment.target: The Machines reporting tile shows the number of machines reporting each day for the past 30 days

segment.source: Machines with active malware detections
segment.target: Machines with active malware detections

segment.source: The Machines with active malware detections tile will only appear if your endpoints are using Windows Defender.
segment.target: The Machines with active malware detections tile will only appear if your endpoints are using Windows Defender.

segment.source: Active malware is defined as threats that are actively executing at the time of detection.
segment.target: Active malware is defined as threats that are actively executing at the time of detection.

segment.source: Hover over each bar to see the number of active malware detections (as Malware detections) and the number of endpoints with at least one active detection (as Machines) over the past 30 days.
segment.target: Hover over each bar to see the number of active malware detections (as Malware detections) and the number of endpoints with at least one active detection (as Machines) over the past 30 days.

segment.source: The Machines with active malware detections tile shows the number of threats and machines for each threat category
segment.target: The Machines with active malware detections tile shows the number of threats and machines for each threat category

segment.source: The chart is sorted into five categories:
segment.target: The chart is sorted into five categories:

segment.source: Password stealer - threats that attempt to steal credentials.
segment.target: Password stealer - threats that attempt to steal credentials.

segment.source: Ransomware - threats that prevent user access to a machine or its files and demand payment to restore access.
segment.target: Ransomware - threats that prevent user access to a machine or its files and demand payment to restore access.

segment.source: Exploit - threats that use software vulnerabilities to infect machines.
segment.target: Exploit - threats that use software vulnerabilities to infect machines.

segment.source: Threat - all other threats that don't fit into the Password stealer, Ransomware, or Exploit categories.
segment.target: Threat - all other threats that don't fit into the Password stealer, Ransomware, or Exploit categories.

segment.source: This includes trojans, worms, backdoors, and viruses.
segment.target: This includes trojans, worms, backdoors, and viruses.

segment.source: Low severity - threats with low severity, including adware and potentially unwanted software such as browser modifiers.
segment.target: Low severity - threats with low severity, including adware and potentially unwanted software such as browser modifiers.

segment.source: Threats are considered "active" if there is a very high probability that the malware was executing on your network, as opposed to statically located on-disk.
segment.target: Threats are considered "active" if there is a very high probability that the malware was executing on your network, as opposed to statically located on-disk.

segment.source: Clicking on any of these categories will navigate to the Machines view, filtered by the appropriate category.
segment.target: Clicking on any of these categories will navigate to the Machines view, filtered by the appropriate category.

segment.source: This lets you see a detailed breakdown of which machines have active malware detections, and how many threats were detected per machine.
segment.target: This lets you see a detailed breakdown of which machines have active malware detections, and how many threats were detected per machine.

segment.source: Note The Machines with active malware detections tile will only appear if your endpoints are using Windows Defender as the default real-time protection antimalware product.
segment.target: Note The Machines with active malware detections tile will only appear if your endpoints are using Windows Defender as the default real-time protection antimalware product.
